name: Bhaktapur Durbar Square
description: Historic royal palace complex and cultural capital with ancient temples, courtyards, and traditional Newari architecture
historical_significance: Former royal palace of the Malla dynasty, showcasing medieval art and culture

name: 55 Window Palace
description: 15th-century masterpiece of traditional Newari architecture with 55 intricately carved wooden windows
historical_significance: Built by King Bhupatindra Malla, showcasing finest wood carving craftsmanship
entry_fee: Included in Bhaktapur Durbar Square ticket

name: Nyatapola Temple
description: Five-storied pagoda temple, the tallest temple in Nepal, dedicated to a Tantric goddess
historical_significance: Built in 1702 during King Bhupatindra Malla's reign, survived the 1933 earthquake
entry_fee: Included in Bhaktapur Durbar Square ticket

name: Taumadhi Square
description: Historic square where Nepal's tallest pagoda Nyatapola temple is located along with Bhairavanath temple
historical_significance: Traditional gathering place and cultural center of Bhaktapur
entry_fee: Included in Bhaktapur Durbar Square ticket

name: Changu Narayan Temple
description: Ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, considered one of the oldest temples in Nepal
historical_significance: Dating back to 4th century, contains the oldest stone inscription in Nepal

name: Golden Gate (Sun Dhoka)
description: Ornate golden entrance gate to the palace complex, adorned with intricate metalwork and carvings
historical_significance: Built during Malla period, entrance to the royal palace complex
entry_fee: Included in Bhaktapur Durbar Square ticket

name: Dattatreya Square
description: Historic square with Dattatreya Temple and traditional Newari architecture
historical_significance: Ancient square showcasing medieval urban planning and religious architecture
entry_fee: Included in Bhaktapur Durbar Square ticket

name: Bhairavanath Temple
description: Three-storied temple dedicated to Bhairava, the fearsome manifestation of Lord Shiva
historical_significance: Important religious site for locals, showcasing traditional pagoda architecture
entry_fee: Included in Bhaktapur Durbar Square ticket

name: Doleshwar Mahadev Temple
description: Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, considered the head part of Kedarnath temple
historical_significance: Believed to be spiritually connected to Kedarnath temple in India

name: Pottery Square
description: Traditional pottery making area where visitors can observe local artisans creating clay pots
historical_significance: Centuries-old pottery tradition of the Prajapati caste in Bhaktapur

name: National Art Gallery
description: Museum housed in a traditional building showcasing ancient art, paintings, and cultural artifacts
historical_significance: Preserves and displays medieval and ancient Nepalese art and culture

name: Kathmandu Durbar Square
description: Historic royal palace complex with ancient temples and courtyards
historical_significance: Former royal palace of the Malla and Shah dynasties

name: Pashupatinath Temple
description: Sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva
historical_significance: One of the most sacred Hindu temples, cremation site

name: Boudhanath Stupa
description: Ancient Buddhist stupa and pilgrimage site
historical_significance: One of the largest stupas in the world, Tibetan Buddhist center

name: Swayambhunath Stupa
description: Ancient religious architecture atop a hill, also known as Monkey Temple
historical_significance: 2000+ years old Buddhist stupa

name: Lumbini
description: Birthplace of Lord Buddha
historical_significance: Sacred Buddhist pilgrimage site, birthplace of Siddhartha Gautama

name: Patan Durbar Square
description: Historic royal palace complex and UNESCO World Heritage Site showcasing finest Newari architecture with temples, courtyards, and royal palaces
historical_significance: Former royal palace of the Malla kings, center of art and culture with over 600 years of history

name: Golden Temple (Hiranya Varna Mahavihar)
description: 12th-century Buddhist monastery with golden pagoda dedicated to Shakyamuni Buddha, also known as Kwa Bahal
historical_significance: Built by King Bhaskar Varman in the 12th century, one of the most important Buddhist monasteries in Nepal

name: Krishna Temple (Krishna Mandir)
description: 17th-century stone temple dedicated to Lord Krishna, built in Shikhara style with intricate carvings depicting Mahabharata scenes
historical_significance: Built by King Siddhi Narasimha Malla, showcases scenes from Hindu epics Mahabharata and Ramayana
entry_fee: Included in Patan Durbar Square ticket

name: Patan Museum
location: Keshav Narayan Chowk, Patan Durbar Square
description: Award-winning museum housed in a restored palace showcasing traditional Nepalese art, bronze sculptures, and cultural artifacts
historical_significance: Preserves and displays centuries of Nepalese religious and cultural art in a restored Malla palace

name: Mahabouddha Temple
description: 14th-century Buddhist temple known as 'Temple of Thousand Buddhas' with terracotta plaques depicting Buddha
historical_significance: Built in 1585 by Abhaya Raj, inspired by the Mahabodhi Temple in Bodh Gaya, India

name: Kumbheshwar Temple
description: 14th-century five-storied pagoda temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, one of only two five-storied temples in Nepal
historical_significance: Built in 1392, one of the oldest temples in Patan and important pilgrimage site

name: Rudra Varna Mahavihar (Uku Bahal)
description: Ancient Buddhist monastery with beautiful architecture and religious significance for local Buddhist community
historical_significance: One of the important Buddhist monasteries in Patan with traditional Newari Buddhist architecture

name: Ashoka Stupas
description: Four ancient Buddhist stupas built by Emperor Ashoka in 250 BC marking the boundaries of ancient Patan
historical_significance: Built during Emperor Ashoka's pilgrimage to Nepal, marking the ancient boundaries of Patan city

name: Red Machhindranath Temple (Rato Machhindranath)
description: Important temple dedicated to Rato Machhindranath, the rain god, famous for its annual chariot festival
historical_significance: Center of the famous Rato Machhindranath Jatra, one of the longest festivals in Nepal

name: Banglamukhi Temple
description: Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Baglamukhi, known for its unique architecture and religious significance
historical_significance: Important tantric temple with specific religious practices and local devotion

name: Sundari Chowk
description: Beautiful royal courtyard within the palace complex featuring the famous Tusha Hiti (Royal Bath)
historical_significance: Royal courtyard of the Malla kings with exquisite stone carvings and water spouts
entry_fee: Included in Patan Durbar Square ticket

name: Mul Chowk
description: Main courtyard of the royal palace complex, the oldest and central part of Patan Durbar Square
historical_significance: Central courtyard where royal ceremonies and religious festivals were conducted
entry_fee: Included in Patan Durbar Square ticket

name: Jawalakhel Handicraft Center
description: Tibetan refugee settlement and handicraft center known for carpet weaving and traditional crafts
historical_significance: Established in 1960s for Tibetan refugees, center for preserving Tibetan culture and crafts

name: Central Zoo (Jawalakhel Zoo)
description: Nepal's only zoo featuring native and exotic animals, popular family destination
historical_significance: Established in 1932, first zoo in Nepal for wildlife conservation and education
